title: Can we stop with the all the slows, please?
body: Ekko has a slow that helps him apply another slow. Ashe has a perma slow that crits every auto. Kalista as a slow that also nukes. Azir has a slow that also hits like a train. Gnar has a slow that has basically no cooldown if he catches it. Can we have someone that does not a a slow with no cooldown or one so short that it might as well not have one?

>It's not hat Ashe has a slow that I care about as she has always had it. It's the fact that you are now perma slowed for free and also getting crit every auto.

The 'crit' only actually increases your overall DPS by 10%, since it deals way less damage than a true crit. Do you know what else increases your DPS by 10% against a CC'd target? Talon's passive that everyone thinks is trash. Not saying Ashe's passive is bad, it obviously has the slow component too but it's really not a huge damage bump.

As for the "for free" part it's only down from 4 mana per second for a good Ashe, since you'd only toggle it on once every 2 attacks with over 1.3ish AS and once every 3 with 1.8ish.

To put that in perspective Ashe regens almost 3 mana a second at level 18.
Ashe's passive scales so it's 10% for a small portion of the game, unlike talon's.

It's 10% all game, only the slow scales.

The damage scales with crit, but it's still only 10% higher than average DPS.

Talon's DPS also scales up the same if you buy crit on him, it's actually slightly better because it's multiplicative in his case.

no it actually scales with crit. 
What this means is that the crit multiplier will actually scale with more crit you get. I dont know the exact numbers but for example's sake if i got phantom dancer thats 30% crit so my multiplier is now 40% instead of 10%
If you buy a Phantom Dancer on any other champion bar Yasou it increases your average auto damage by 30%. This is the same amount Ashe gets by buying a PD.
doesnt that increase the chance to crit not the actual. I thought the standard crit multiplier was 200% with holding yas ashe and infin edge

PD's actually 35%, but anyway.

with no PD you have 0% chance to deal 200% bonus damage, therefore your average auto damage is 100%

with PD you have a 35% chance to deal 200% bonus damage or a 65% chance to deal normal
0.35x2+0.65x1=1.35, which is your long term average crit damage.

All Ashe's passive does is work out that damage number and use it as a multiplier, adding 10%.

Wrong. The 10% bonus damage she has is completely separate from any of the crit multipliers she gains. The equation works like this: (100% AD x 1.1) + (100% AD x (crit chance x 1+crit damage multiplier)).

If you bought a Phantom dancer which has 35% crit chance, it would increase her crits from 110% crit damage to 145%, but if you had an IE instead it would go from 110% to 140%, where having both IE and PD brings you from 110% up to a whopping 192.5%, instead of just 175% like your math would have it.
